body: Is/was the browser trusting ZAP's certs? That page has styles from https://assets.genius.com/ (note the HTTPS scheme).

Yes. That is the reason why the page was loading properly when it was intercepting via ZAP without any proxy rules. Btw, the following is the configuration of my machine.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13018530/19478928/acf803d6-9544-11e6-9d1f-d65956c73360.png)

Were you able to reproduce the issue with the latest version of ZAP and the 2.5 stable version?

Update: I was able to reproduce the issue in a Windows 10 machine with yesterday's ZAP weekly release. Please note that you must clear the browsing history when you try to load the web page with the Zest proxy rule. Otherwise, you will not be able to see the issue because the browser uses the cached stylesheet from the previous session in which the Zest proxy rule was not activated.
I was able to reproduce the issue, it's related to the character encoding of the (CSS) response. Thanks!
Great! Can't wait for the fixed weekly release.

rename.from: Zest proxy rules messing up web page loading
rename.to: Wrong charset used in response body if no charset set

issue.title: Attempt to determine (String) body's charset

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change HttpBody and HttpResponseBody to attempt to determine the charset
of the contents (String) being set if the charset is unknown (that is,
it was not previously set before the contents are set).
Update tests to reflect the change in the behaviour.

Related to #2487 - Wrong charset used in HTTP body
Fix #2935 - Wrong charset used in response body if no charset set

body:
I thought the issue was resolved when you marked it as closed. But I downloaded yesterday's weekly release (D-2016-10-24) and the issue is still there. You should be able to reproduce the issue in the same way as I explained earlier.
The following screenshot shows the web page loading correctly when the ZEST proxy rule is disabled.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13018530/19684658/c3d3da5c-9ab8-11e6-8abf-9c21ef4f74ae.png)

The following screenshot shows the web page loading incorrectly when the ZEST proxy rule is enabled (the proxy rule does not tamper the requests or responses).
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13018530/19684693/ea60106e-9ab8-11e6-97ab-3c68fed1c939.png)
What are the conditions of the script?

Works for me with the latest weekly release. Could you provide a screenshot of the history tab after requesting the site? Preferably sorted by URL (only interested in the URL and size of response body, other columns could be hidden).
Instead of screenshot you could just copy/paste the contents of the history tab.

Sorry I didn't understand when you said copy/paste the contents of the history tab because when I do a Ctrl+A in the history tab and right click I only have the option "Copy URLs to clipboard". Here is the screenshot that you requested before.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13018530/19686490/aea7943a-9ac1-11e6-94e5-feb8791df404.png)

You can use the copy keyboard shortcut (usually Ctrl + C) to copy the selected rows.
It's better to copy as the unit of the response body is in bytes and it includes the whole URL.

The previous screenshot was with the Zest script enabled?

Yes the screenshot is with the Zest script enabled.
The following is the PASTE after doing CTRL+C in the history tab.


<sub>Edit by kingthorin 20161025: Added code tags to make things more user friendly.</sub>

Thanks, there's a difference on the size of the CSS response. Upon reviewing the code again I spotted the issue, there's a statement that's relying on the platform's default encoding (and that's why it's working here and not there).

Would you mind test a new "weekly release" with the fix applied?

issue.title: Correct charset determination in HttpResponseBody

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Remove use of platform's default charset when determining if the charset
of the string is UTF-8, which was leading to wrong results if the
platform's default charset was not UTF-8.

Related to:
- #2935 - Wrong charset used in response body if no charset set
- #2941 - Attempt to determine (String) body's charset

body: No problem, I would love to have the fixed version because I need it. So I can do the test and you will have your results.

Thanks, the release is available at:
https://github.com/thc202/zaproxy/releases/tag/w2016-10-25

Looks like it works! Thank you.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13018530/19693789/183bb618-9add-11e6-981d-efcabc5d9530.png)
Great, thanks for letting us know!
